definition: to call the wind and summon the rain (idiom); to exercise magical powers/fig. to stir up troubles
to call/to cry/to shout/to breath out/to exhale
wind/news/style/custom/manner/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],絲|丝[si1]
to call
rain/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],場|场[chang2]
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: I have also been brilliant in the flat g summon wind and rain.
sentences.chinese: 我也輝煌過，在單位前呼後擁，呼風喚雨。

sentences.english: It is said to rule the rivers and seas and dominate the clouds and rains.
sentences.chinese: 據說龍掌管着河流大海，能呼風喚雨。

sentences.english: Those pearls have supernatural power which can make your dreams cone true.
sentences.chinese: 寶珠有神奇力量，可以呼風喚雨，隨心所欲。

sentences.english: You know, I used to walk tall around here .
sentences.chinese: 你知道，我以前在這裏呼風喚雨。

definition: to triumph in every battle (idiom); invincible/to succeed in every undertaking
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
elated and excited (idiom); overjoyed
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
matchless/without equal/there is nothing better
lit. lively dragon and animated tiger (idiom)/fig. vigorous and lively
magnificent army with thousands of men and horses (idiom); impressive display of manpower/all the King's horses and all the King's men
magnificent style unmatched in his generation (idiom); peerless talent
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
lit. to squander money like dirt (idiom)/fig. to spend money like water/extravagant
to die in battle (idiom)
important matter that must be kept secret (idiom); don't breathe a word of it to anyone!
to be chivalrous
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
